title: So Taliyah is azir 2.0
body:
Complete garbage for the common player, broken for the pros.  Though riot hit azir so hard with the nerf bat I don't see him anywhere anymore. I'm trying to find Taliyahs strength now.  She has a weak early game,  no damage so the most she can do is snowball other lanes so a mediocre mid game,  and a weak late game where she's basically just a utility bot of slows,  walls,  and knock ups. I guess she's a support?

I saw somewhere Taliyaha winrate dropped to 42%, it might go up a few more but that's it imo.

replies.body: As a taliyah player with 80 or so ranked games with her her q is offically one of the worst abilites to use on minions in the game takes 2-3 q's on unworked ground to clear a wave aswell as your combo is not enough to kill an adc if the adc has maw It would take you hitting 10 qs and your full combo she is outclassed in every aspect by other mages at this point even sol outroams her now

It's weird, because they wanted Taliyah to use her E for waveclear, and her Q to harass in a smart way. So they put the bonus damage to minions on her Q? And then nerf the crap out of her E. And THEN take away the bonus damage on her Q.

So what do they want exactly? I'm surprised they haven't simply given back some of the damage on her E (atleast in the later ranks) already, but apparently it needed even more of a nerf.
becuase riot doesnt know how to no Gut champions used in pro play

[Your winrate with her](http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=ninjablood2) is 53% with 86 games played.
I consider that pretty good. Her global winrate, according to [Taliyah's champion.gg](http://www.champion.gg/champion/taliyah) is 49.29%. Not bad either.

The whole point to making changes to her Q is that she doesn't get to delete the pressure that an enemy laner applies to her lane by simply using rotation of her spells on a wave and then by the time she catches up with her ult to gank, she gets to have the best of both worlds.

The whole point in reducing her E damage was done because her W was mechanically changed and it doesn't have a lock-out period anymore. The fact that Taliyah can now cast more and diverse spells (and can move) while she sets up the W means her potential for dealing damage is greater.

Sol should outroam Taliyah as his roam isn't tied to his ultimate ability. Sol's roam also doesn't have a global sound and it doesn't announce he is coming and he usually has his Q big enough to already stun people or force them to avoid it.

The 49.29% is based on patch 6.17, the closest thing to the new patch I was able to find is [Taliyah's Lolking stats](http://www.lolking.net/champions/taliyah?chartType=winrate&region=na&map=sr&queue=1x1&league=ranked#statistics) which puts her at a an average of 42.5% winrate across NA, EUW, EUNE as of September 8th, which was the 6.18 patch date.

I havn't seen her even before the nerfs. I really hope she doesn't become Azir and gets gutted. Because the pros in LCS dominated with the champ. 

Then now the 0.01% influenced nerfs. It's only 0.01% that really showed how good he was.

Hope it doesn't happen again to Taliyah.

Riot: "Who wants W to be changed to vector cast?"
Taliyah mains/frequent players/those with a lot of experience on her: "not us"
People who know jackshit about her and/or almost never played her if at all: "us"
Riot: Let's listen to people who know nothing.

Now, replace Riot's question with "Who wants the lockout removed"/"Who wants the other W changes that came along with the vector cast change"/"Who wants unnecessary buffs for Worlds and then crushing nerfs to proceed to gut her afterwards?".

Thanks Riot. Love you too.

As yes, the W change. The W change that ruined Taliyah for me (from a gameplay standpoint).
For weeks following her release, I played & enjoyed her a lot. I had good games & I had bad games. I stuck through with her even though her win rates were in the dumpster. Played her enough & got skilled enough to earn a level 6 mastery (don't believe me? Look it up). I was a competent Taliyah player & I was happy.

All that change when her W was changed to vector cast. Everytime I play her now, it's just a battle to make her W do what I want without screwing me. Everything else is the same, but the W is an important part of her combo that I mess up on now. I look at the level 6 mastery I have with & all I see is a lie. I am no longer a competent Taliyah player. 

I'm not saying her W change was bad, I just suck with her now. Though, I will still play her once in a blue moon. Hoping that one day, I will catch the glory I had with her before the W changes. But whatever, there's plenty of other mid laners to play that I'm actually competent with.

I agree with most of this.  I was obsessed with Taliyah when she was released.  She was tricky to play because of the different casting style with the lockout and that made it fun to learn her and I got to mastery 7 with her.  Then they changed the casting type to vector and since then she just doesn't feel the same.  My favourite way to play her was using her e into w combo to burst people and that was fun for me, I never maxed q ever and I never had an issue.  Landing the combo wasn't difficult when you played her often enough, you got the feel for it.  Now with the change in casting it just feels uncomfortable and awkward and in most situations it's just better to cast w into e.  I hate this change, it takes away the fun elements for me and I feel like maxing q was the only option since I couldn't play Taliyah the way I learned and enjoyed.  

For myself, I no longer find playing her enjoyable and if the casting type was reverted I would happily pick her up again despite her various damage nerfs.  I can live with nerfs, you can always find new builds to accommodate and work around number changes.  But the casting change changed the champions play style for me and that is why I no longer enjoy playing her.

"Taliyah mains" after less than a week of her being out. Right.

She wasn't popular. Riot wanted her to be more intuitive to the general playerbase, so they listened to the general playerbase. 

Nothing Riot did was wrong. 

Taliyah's deserved every nerf she's gotten. Skarner still wasn't popular when he was OP. Doesn't mean he didn't deserve the nerfs.

> [{quoted}](name=WoonStruck,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2yjWOA1t,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2016-09-09T16:59:52.118+0000)
>
> "Taliyah mains" after less than a week of her being out. Right.
> 
> She wasn't popular. Riot wanted her to be more intuitive to the general playerbase, so they listened to the general playerbase. 
> 
> Nothing Riot did was wrong. 
> 
> Taliyah's deserved every nerf she's gotten. Skarner still wasn't popular when he was OP. Doesn't mean he didn't deserve the nerfs.

Last time I checked 2 months back, I was met with death threats for playing Taliyah for how garbage she is. Those games weren't the happiest, but gaining LP is happiness I guess. 

And you do know that people have been playing champs once they come out for PBE testing, right? Some people are that dedicated to the champs they love to play. Why? They love to have fun. 

Also, you never kick dedicated fanbases to the side to cater to the general populace. Just look at Medal of Honor. Tried to attract the CoD fanbase and didn't care about their existing dedicated fans. Guess what resulted from that. Games like XCOM had developers who actually cared for their dedicated fans, hence why it isn't dead yet. Case in point, Riot made a big mistake. More specifically DanielZKlein made a big mistake.

> Also, you never kick dedicated fanbases to the side to cater to the general populace. 

Riot does this all the time. The other games you listed are irrelevant because they aren't Riot. **Riot sits up on a high-horse thinking they can do no wrong.** I'm just saying that, according to their previous history, what they did was not wrong. There's no reason Taliyah should be a special snowflake when they've shafted so many other champions in far worse ways, even.

You can argue that Riot's directions as a game are wrong, and I'd definitely agree, but that's getting pretty tangential.

> [{quoted}](name=WoonStruck,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2yjWOA1t,comment-id=0005000000010000,timestamp=2016-09-10T06:52:16.825+0000)
>
> Riot does this all the time. The other games you listed are irrelevant because they aren't Riot. **Riot sits up on a high-horse thinking they can do no wrong.** I'm just saying that, according to their previous history, what they did was not wrong. There's no reason Taliyah should be a special snowflake when they've shafted so many other champions in far worse ways, even.
> 
> You can argue that Riot's directions as a game are wrong, and I'd definitely agree, but that's getting pretty tangential.

And they shouldn't do that. Riot will pay the price once they do this too often. I think they're starting to learn their lesson because Kog'Maw is becoming a Special Snowflake and getting a revert to his old self. I'm not sure if I should feel jealous or glad for Kog'Maw's playerbase lol. 

The problem with Taliyah's changes is that Riot went in circles with her and ended up making her even worse to play than she was on release. After they removed Lockout, she became an unbalanced mess due to her ability to W E. The ability to perform W into E made that setup lose all counterplay and forced those two skills to be nerfed into the ground. E can barely perform it's function as a zone anymore, being nothing more than a tacked on Utility skill that is mainly used for cheap DPS. Of course, performing E into W was affected by this change, effectively making it not optimal to use despite it being her main setup before.

In my opinion, Riot screwed this one up more than they did with Kog'Maw. Taliyah cannot be balanced in this state because the nature of her E and W require a mechanic like Lockout. It's the simplest solution if Riot doesn't want to code specific situations into her kit such as E does not have falloff if E into W is performed. She'll either be garbage or overpowered. I'd rather stick with garbage at this point until some proper adjustments are made or a revert happens. Riot made her too accessible and that goes against her high skill floor, high skill ceiling design altogether.

I get where riot is coming from with vector casting, because people thought the lockout wasn't fun and Taliyah was a lot less popular than expected. I like her either way ok. I think that's unrelated mostly to the issue of her current balance state though

> [{quoted}](name=Monado II,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2yjWOA1t,comment-id=0005000000010001,timestamp=2016-09-10T08:16:51.099+0000)
>
> I get where riot is coming from with vector casting, because people thought the lockout wasn't fun and Taliyah was a lot less popular than expected. I like her either way ok. I think that's unrelated mostly to the issue of her current balance state though

Lockout balanced her E W combo. Without it, she's becoming an unbalanced mess because of the ability to land W E with ease. Back when she had to use E into W, it had counterplay. Opponents can preempt what she wants to do and simply walk away. This justified her insanely high E damage because it was situational and mostly used for punishing bad positioning and excessive gapclosers. E could've been used as a zone or as a hard to land burst combo. 

Riot handled her Vector Casting change VERY poorly. They didn't fine-tune it in the slightest and didn't even go ask Taliyah mains for adjustments. She just needs a unique form of casting altogether. Vector Casting isn't cutting it because doesn't suit her W at all from just using it. You can't even see it's radius lol. Of course that is only one of the many issues it has.

Can y'all just stop with that PBE? 
20 PBE games on a champ doesn't make u a "main" or something.  And certainly not a "dedicated" player. Dedicated players play champs even when they are not fotm.
Not even considering that only NA has decent access to PBE and NA already has a smaller playerbase than other big regions so geee this PBE thing is no argument.

> [{quoted}](name=GayFluffyUnicorn,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2yjWOA1t,comment-id=0005000000010002,timestamp=2016-09-10T23:30:46.625+0000)
>
> Can y'all just stop with that PBE? 
> 20 PBE games on a champ doesn't make u a "main" or something.  And certainly not a "dedicated" player. Dedicated players play champs even when they are not fotm.
> Not even considering that only NA has decent access to PBE and NA already has a smaller playerbase than other big regions so geee this PBE thing is no argument.

It's something. People have access to early testing and some people just really like new champions. 

Also, what does it take to be a main? Not everyone has the time to play 24/7 and gain 100 games on one champion in a matter of 2 weeks. People have lives. 20 games on the PBE with one champ is quite a lot, especially when new champs are only in there for about 2 weeks. 

Remember when Taliyah was "garbage"? Yeah. People still played her when she came out because they liked her. That is until a majority dropped her after patch 6.14 for those ridiculous changes. I only fit like 60-70 games as Taliyah in between May and July because I had real life stuff to deal with. Does that make me not dedicated and not a main just because I don't have the time to play? 

I'd rather listen to someone who has played 20 Taliyah games over someone who hasn't played Taliyah at all. At least they'd have an opinion worth noting. Clearly you can see why I'd say that.

Not every Taliyah player disliked the W changes.  I was asking for them from the start, and still hold that they're for the best.

The majority of Taliyah players simply downvoted the comments of myself and others to hell.  Nobody even gave a proper argument against it other than that they were used to the way her W was originally set up.

Yeah, I don't understand why everybody thinks that the entire Taliyah playerbase wanted her original casting.

I'm not a Taliyah player, but I remember the post about Taliyah Mains and "Taliyah Mains" just downvoting every post saying, I like the new vector casting. 

People don't understand that not everything is going to be black and white. Not all original players are gonna like old casting, not all non-Taliyah players like Vector casting.

The issues are:

Old W immediately started the 1 second delay (I think that's how long it was?) the moment you put your cursor down. That meant no matter what, it'd always trigger 1s after the initial click. No possible extraneous delay. And then you had anywhere in that 1s to choose a direction, which meant you weren't locked into a decision at the beginning. Also, knockups (directly up) were possible.

New W wouldn't start until you drag and let go, meaning there's always an extraneous delay from human movement/reaction speed in addition to the 1s cast delay. You were forced into a direction at the start. You lost vertical knockup. The circle indicator disappeared and got replaced by a single point. And it became extremely buggy/inconsistent/etc when casting near the edges/past its casting range, unlike before.

Also they removed the lockout which was the entire restriction of balancing Taliyah's damage with her E-W combo. It took skill and practice to land it, and you were locked out during it. However, if you could land it, you could deal massive damage. Now they removed the lockout and neutered the damage in return, added 50% damage boost to minions on Q, swapped things around, and then eventually nerfed any other buffs they did.

http://champion.gg/champion/Taliyah

63% winrate on people who played a lot of games with her, and higher than average play rate for a mid laner. she was nerfed for worlds.

i think my best moment with her so far was in an aram game in a standoff with a syndra. we were both incredibly low on health, with all our cooldowns ready. she was hiding in the bush next to our second turret, while i was on the opposite side of the lane.

the moment she stepped out of th bush, i ulted and knocked her into my turret with the wall for the kill.
I don't see how 6.17 stats are relevant to the 6.18 state of her,  that really just proves the point is she being azir 2.0. The mains do great,  everyone else not so much

Azir's mains never hit that high of a winrate he is way harder than taliyah is.  Azir's problem is that his kit was complete bullshit, thats why riot kept nerfing him.   Taliyah's problem is that she is too strong when played by mains, they aren't even comparable.

We don't have enough information to reliably gauge the 6.18 state of her, we have to rely on 6.17 info at this point.

To your "I took her full combo as Jhin comment", it was in a game where she rushed {{item:3151}} and it was her only completed item. For the same price she could have gotten pretty much any other AP item and done significantly more damage. She lost a grand total of 30 damage (pre MR) to you with the nerf she got in 6.18, it wasn't the nerfs but rather their items that was the problem that game.

Well she got nerfed even harder in both waveclear (less gold/roaming/lane dominance) as well as her E damage.
So it'd hurt her 6.18 considerably in comparison to 6.17.
Not riots fault most players are to terrible to use utility champions correctly.
Just curious... How did you guys aim the direction of the push on her W before the vector change?

If you are asking how it worked, it was you hit W to activate it, which would then have that spot where you hit the W key to have a direction you'd choose, following the mouse. You could lock in the direction by hitting W again or have it knock-up enemies by not hitting W a second time, rather than displace enemies.

If you are asking about how they could stand using it, it wasn't as bad as some people felt. I don't own her yet, but I tried her on the PBE and played her on free week a few times and I got the hang of it after a game or two.

That sounds like too many actions to pull it off, I have to say I prefer the vector change then in that case. In the old way it sounds like the enemy could move out of the way before you even got the ability casted!

No, the moment you clicked the first time with old W, it would begin to cast, and the push/knockup would happen after 1 second no matter what.

With the new W, it won't start the 1s timer until you drag and let go, which adds an impossible-to-avoid human delay. And the whole point of this ability is to use it predicatively in the first place, with a 1s delay on it.
It was a double tap thing that could be much, much stronger, so long as you were quick enough. It's similar to the vector cast speed if done correctly.
Aurelion Sol is also Azir 2.0
Can we add {{champion:421}} to this list too
Np fam
All of this azir 2.0 ....but but but I liked azir 1.0 and now I can't even play him he's so gutted=(

> [{quoted}](name=whitetrash366,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2yjWOA1t,comment-id=000d000000000000,timestamp=2016-09-10T01:57:31.487+0000)
>
> All of this azir 2.0 ....but but but I liked azir 1.0 and now I can't even play him he's so gutted=(

curse of shurima....

more like Taliyah is azir 9.0

ironically her lore suggests that she descends from azirs people xD

> [{quoted}](name=thacrazytaco,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2yjWOA1t,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-09-09T13:18:54.765+0000)

> Complete garbage for the common player, broken for the pros.  Though riot hit azir so hard with the nerf bat I don&#039;t see him anywhere anymore. I&#039;m trying to find Taliyahs strength now.  She has a weak early game,  no damage so the most she can do is snowball other lanes so a mediocre mid game,  and a weak late game where she&#039;s basically just a utility bot of slows,  walls,  and knock ups. I guess she&#039;s a support?
> 
> I saw somewhere Taliyaha winrate dropped to 42%, it might go up a few more but that&#039;s it imo.

No damage, what? She can kill you with one ability.
No, she can't.
Like, literally, her damage relies on hitting two abilities. And her ult doesn't even do any damage.
She still has damage, but her farming took a huge nerf because she can't just Q a wave and it all dies.
When I can tank Taliyahs full combo and kill her as Jhin she has anything but damage

Even with {{item:3156}} , WEQ + Thunderlords proc from Taliyah will bring you below 30% all things considered even.

Not that you experience good midlaners in Bronze though, so I guess you misunderstand her strength against an immobile ADC. :)
OI We don't use rank as a comparison of skill on boards.
A champ being weak in bronze is irrelevant to general gameplay balance

She was balanced on release in my opinion
But Riot saw her low winrate and was like
"LET US CHANGE EVERYTHING"

Oh please, Taliyah got nerfed but she is still viable. I don't mean to be rude but Azir has been destroyed by his nerf, removing a lot of the utility that I thought made him fun, in exchange for high damage but then they nerfed his damage anyways. Azir is a shell of a champion, Taliyah is still fun and can have high moments. Think of all the different and unique things you can do with her kit. Now think of what you can do with Azir. She has a lot more potential to be fun and a lot more options which is what I feel makes her (and used to make Azir) so unique.

Sorry, I am just seriously pissed off at how Riot throws certain champions in the dumpster and forgets about them.

Is this thread serious? Taliyahs q can take half of someones health at level 1, and her full combo at level 3 is enough to kill some mid laners. ESPECIALLY if you poke them once or twice with her q. And unlike azir who actually had some difficulty in my mind, a taliyah with rylais has to land one ability and then that person is dead due to either her e, w combo, or her q hitting them afterwards. She is ridiculously strong as one of the mages that build health and ap items. My problem with her is the same problem i have with sol. That she can have upwards of 2,500 health and still instant burst anyone with around 2000. You cant get close enough to her to kill her and if you do, you probably wont do enough damage anyways.

I tried to main Aurelion Sol jungle before the W colldown nerf and the ult nerf, and now there's massive nerfs on the PBE too. They might not go through but it goes to show they're planning even more nerfs for the guy. It feels like these two new champs just can't see play

they aint flashy enough so riot needs to gut them :D
So no one thought I was just joking?
